column1: Throughout the long and difficult period of Watergate
column2: I have felt it was my duty to persevere — to make every possible effort to complete the term of office to which you elected me. In the past few days
column4: it has become evident to me that I no longer have a strong enough political base in the Congress to justify continuing that effort. As long as there was such a base
column5: I felt strongly that it was necessary to see the constitutional process through to its conclusion; that to do otherwise would be unfaithful to the spirit of that deliberately difficult process
column6: and a dangerously destabilizing precedent for the future. But with the disappearance of that base
column7: I now believe that the constitutional purpose has been served. And there is no longer a need for the process to be prolonged.I would have preferred to carry through to the finish whatever the personal agony it would have involved
column8: and my family unanimously urged me to do so. But the interests of the nation must always come before any personal considerations.
